definition: to blindly follow suit (idiom)/to imitate slavishly/to do what everyone else is doing
also
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
surname Bu
also
to hasten/to hurry/to walk fast/to approach/to tend towards/to converge

sentences.english: And this kind of uncomfortableness associates and follows everyone of us closely.
sentences.chinese: 而且這種不適感如影隨形，與我們每個人亦步亦趨。

sentences.english: In fact, Beddgelert would follow his master's every move.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，貝德格勒特對主人亦步亦趨。

sentences.english: These companies are no longer content to be mere followers.
sentences.chinese: 這些企業不再滿足於亦步亦趨。

to converge

transition

leadership
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another

political relations
to become a mere formality
